external_references.description: Hacioglu, S. (2025, March 10). Qilin Ransomware: Exposing the TTPs Behind One of the Most Active Ransomware Campaigns of 2024. Retrieved September 26, 2025.
Halcyon RISE Team. (2024, October 24). New Qilin.B Ransomware Variant Boasts Enhanced Encryption and Defense Evasion. Retrieved September 26, 2025.
Health Sector Cybersecurity Coordination Center. (2024, June 18). Qilin, aka Agenda Ransomware. Retrieved September 26, 2025.
Magdy, S. et al. (2022, August 25). New Golang Ransomware Agenda Customizes Attacks. Retrieved September 26, 2025.
Thomas, W. (2024, June 12). Tracking Adversaries: The Qilin RaaS. Retrieved September 26, 2025.

objects.description: [Qilin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1242) can use AES-256 or ChaCha20 for domain-wide encryption of victim servers and workstations and RSA-4096 or RSA-2048 to secure generated encryption keys.(Citation: Trend Micro Agenda Ransomware AUG 2022)(Citation: SentinelOne Qilin NOV 2022)(Citation: Picus Qilin MAR 2025)(Citation: BushidoToken Qilin RaaS JUN 2024)(Citation: Halcyon Qilin.B OCT 2024)(Citation: HC3 Qilin Threat Profile JUN 2024)
